page.title: 02SOUTH SHREWSBURY LANDSCAPE
page.content: The landscape is a gentle rolling one which to the south reaches 1O4 metres above sea level on the{Sharpstone Hill dropping to around 5O metres in the north where the{Rea Brook}winds its way to the{River Severn.}To the north- west the{Rad Brook}cuts deeply making the landscape hilly. Housing has tended to keep away from the brooks leaving attractive, natural areas in south{Shrewsbury.}More open spaces have been created at the cemetery, the golf course and the large playing fields of the{Technical College,}the {Comprehensive Schools}and{Shrewsbury {School.}Originally three railway lines arrowed towards the railway station but only two are now operative the other providing a foopath and cycle track. Soon a new Shrewsbury By-pass is to be built ridding Shrewsbury of its through traffic congestion.
